sec.p:
Laboratory bioassay data revealed that the essential oil of C. dioscoridis exhibited strongest repellency toward ticks compared to all other essential oils. Therefore, the essential oil of C. dioscoridis was applied in the field trail at a concentration of 6.5 µg/cm 2. This oil elicited a significant repellent activity against I. ricinus nymphs on two consecutive days ( P < 0.05, Fig. 1).
Fig. 1
Mean number of ticks attracted toward control and Conyza dioscoridis essential oil treated clothes in the field trial. Columns with different letters are significantly different from each other ( P < 0.05)
